intro: Anguillaria australis, commonly known as the Australian angel's trumpet, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its large, showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white. The plant has smooth, dark green leaves and produces clusters of fleshy, berry-like fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it contains toxic compounds that require careful handling.
